snippet: Honda and the air bag maker Takata did not disclose the dangers of exploding air bags for years, despite red flags, opting to settle confidential claims but not issue recalls.
abstract: Honda and air bag maker Takata did not disclose dangers of exploding air bags for years, despite red flags, opting to settle confidential claims but not issue recalls; delays by both Honda and Takata in alerting the public about the defect meant other automakers were not aware of faults in their own vehicles; to date, more than 14 million vehicles have been recalled by 11 automakers over rupture risks involving Takata air bags.

byline.contributor: Bill Vlasic contributed reporting, and Daeil Kim contributed research.

lead_paragraph: Honda and the air bag maker Takata did not disclose the dangers of exploding air bags for years, despite red flags, opting to settle confidential claims but not issue recalls.

headline.main: Air Bag Flaw, Long Known to Honda and Takata, Led to Recalls
